newsitem.title: USA: American Brands says on pace for EPS growth.
newsitem.headline: American Brands says on pace for EPS growth.

text.p: American Brands Inc said Tuesday the current fiscal year is on track to post growth in its earnings per share in the range of 10 percent.
The projection, it said, excludes one-time items and is line with the company's long-term growth goal.

After the company completes its spinoff of the U.K.-based Gallaher tobacco unit, its long-term goal for growth in earnings per share for the new Fortune Brands company is expected to be in the range of 13 percent to 15 percent it said.
American Brands will be changing its name to Fortune Brands after the spin-off.
For fiscal 1995, American Brands posted earnings for ongoing operations of $2.87 per share. Fully diluted earnings for the period were $2.81 per share.
